column5: Once again I got out with Jaydub to hit up some of our spots on Simcoe.  It wasn't long before he had a very, very big fish on.  got it near the boat but he lost it!  We didn't have a net and I guess you could say it was my fault because I forgot to bring it.  Five minutes pass and Jaydub has another good fish on.  He loses that one as well. (I am kind of laughing inside because I had this problem last wed evening.)  Another five minutes pass and Jaydub hooks into yet another big bass.  After a good fight Jaydub manages to boat a new PB smallmouth.  Night fell and we started our usual topwater ritual.  Fish weren't hitting as hard tonight but we still managed quite a few.  Jaydub managed the biggest night bass as well.  Fun night and bigcongrats to Jaydub on a nice PB (see Jacques I told you we would beat his old PB). I was soundly outfished yet again tonight but as a consolation, I did catch the most fish.  Jaydub's big smallie  Same fish - look how fat she is  Good night smallie
That baby would have put the dollar outfit to the test Nice smallie
That is a fat fish, good work!
Damb Cudz..  It looks like you have lady Simcoe figured out.  Nice Smallie!
Jeebus that fish looks like me after an all you can eat BUFFET. Congrats. They have started to fatten up allready. ?Mmmmmmm
What a fat sow!      WTG!!  YOU WIN>>

She can still humble you at times. I have been fishing Simcoe for 23 years and still learn things all the time.  I have learned more in the past 4 years than I did the previous 19 together.  I actually study a 6 mile portion of the lake and know it really really well. I only have limited knowledge of a quater of the lake though.  It is so big with so much shoreline and different bottoms it is going to take me a lifetime to get a better understanding.  I don't think I will ever actually figure her out but for now it is fun.
What a fat fish. Very nice.
When you fish with the right guys, good things happen! lol  This hog put up a fun fight!
I can never tell your reports from one another. All giants! All Simcoe! All seasons! Nice work out there
